docs.snippet: Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte said Saturday he would scrap peace talks with communist rebels and asked several rebel leaders who were freed for the negotiations to return to prison or face arrests in the latest blow to efforts to peacefully...
docs.lead_paragraph: Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte said Saturday he would scrap peace talks with communist rebels and asked several rebel leaders who were freed for the negotiations to return to prison or face arrests in the latest blow to efforts to peacefully settle one of Asia's longest-running rebellions.

headline.main: Philippine President Says He Won't Resume Talks With Rebels
headline.print_headline: Philippine President Says He Won't Resume Talks With Rebels
